info.name: From AOT Proxy API To Salesforce
info.description:
API specification for AOT Proxy to upload daily sales transactions to Salesforce.

AOT Proxy receives transaction data from AOT and:
1. Validates transaction data (field validation, data type, empty values, defaults)
2. If validation fails: Updates TMS_Daily_Sales_File__c status to "Failed" via PATCH by external ID
3. If validation passes: Updates TMS_Daily_Sales_File__c status to "New" via PATCH by external ID
4. Upserts Sales Transaction records using Bulk API (>10k records) or REST API (<10k records)
5. If bulk upload fails: Updates TMS_Daily_Sales_File__c status to "In Progress" (reset) with updateOnly=true
6. If bulk upload succeeds: Updates TMS_Daily_Sales_File__c status to "Uploaded" with updateOnly=true

Reference: seq-diagram/flow-29#1-02-upsert-transactions.md

urlencoded.description: Consumer key from the connected app definition
Consumer secret from the connected app definition

request.description:
Obtain an access token using OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow for server-to-server integration.
This flow is used when no user interaction is required and the application acts on its own behalf.

AOT Proxy must authenticate to Salesforce using this endpoint before calling other APIs.

item.name: Upsert or update TMS Daily Sales File by external ID (Primary endpoint)

query.description: If true, only update existing records (do not create new ones)

request.description:
Upsert or update TMS Daily Sales File record using external ID field (TMS_External_File_Ref__c).

This is the PRIMARY endpoint used throughout Flow-29#1-02. Since PATCH to an external ID field
performs UPSERT in Salesforce, this endpoint will:
- Create the record if it doesn't exist (first time)
- Update the record if it already exists (subsequent calls)

**Stage 1: After Validation (lines 31, 39)**
- If validation fails: Upsert with status "Failed"
- If validation succeeds: Upsert with status "Uploading"

**Stage 2: After Bulk API Upload (lines 72, 79)**
- If bulk API fails: Update status to "In Progress" (reset) with updateOnly=true
- If bulk API succeeds: Update status to "Uploaded" with updateOnly=true

The updateOnly query parameter prevents creating new records - it will only update existing ones.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Get successful records from bulk job

request.description:
Retrieve CSV data of successfully processed records from the bulk job.
Only available after job reaches JobComplete state.

Use this to:
- Confirm which transaction item records were successfully upserted
- Reconcile transaction item data
- Update TMS_Daily_Sales_File__c with success count

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Bad Request - Job not complete yet

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Get failed records from bulk job

request.description:
Retrieve CSV data of failed records with error details from the bulk job.
Only available after job reaches JobComplete state.

Use this to:
- Identify which specific transaction items failed
- Get detailed error messages for each failed record
- Implement retry logic for failed records
- Update TMS_Daily_Sales_File__c with failure details

response.name: Failed results retrieved

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Get unprocessed records from bulk job

request.description:
Retrieve CSV data of records that were not processed.
Only available after job reaches JobComplete, Failed, or Aborted state.

Records may be unprocessed due to:
- Job was aborted
- System errors during processing
- Timeout issues

Use this to identify records that need to be resubmitted.

response.name: Job not found or no unprocessed records

request.description:

After uploading data, you must close the job to start processing.

item.name: Create Bulk API 2.0 Ingest Job (for > 10k records)

request.description:
Create a bulk ingest job for upserting large volumes of transaction item data.
Use this for transaction items greater than 10,000 records.

Object: TMS_Temp_Sales_Transaction_Item__c
External ID: TMS_External_Sequence_Ref__c

Flow-29#1-02 line 38: "Bulk API (Async) > 10,000 records"

After creating the job:
1. Upload CSV data using PUT /jobs/ingest/{jobId}/batches
2. Close the job using PATCH /jobs/ingest/{jobId}
3. Monitor job status using GET /jobs/ingest/{jobId}

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Batch Insert Summary Sales Transaction Units

request.description:
Batch insert operation for Temp_Shop_Unit_Summary_Sales_Trn__c records.
Creates multiple summary sales transaction unit records in a single API call.

Use this endpoint for up to 200 records. The operation uses allOrNone=true,
meaning either all records succeed or the entire batch is rolled back.

Data source: Daily sales summary file (e.g., 0903001_SALES_20251127135523.txt)
Contains aggregated sales data per branch with fields:
- File metadata (file name)
- Shop and branch identifiers
- Sales date and type
- Aggregated sales amount and receipt count

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
